title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Movies+thread+discussion+&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=c6623226acf7856bb5a61313af7bec382c8525f1
comments: Watching **Dahan: Raakan ka Rahasya** and **Criminal Justice S3** on Disney Hotstar.
if anything happens, i love you on netflix is really good. Also, the boys season 3, but disappointed with how they end every season kind of resetting everything

I'm on episode 3 of Hot Milf bhabhi devar ko choda , 

i know art house movies take symbolism and vague sexual shots to depict and make commentary on the human condition , but right now I'm not getting it at all, it all just looks like a long multi part sequence of two people shagging.
Recently watched sneaky pete on prime enjoyed it. Liked new fantanstic beast moive also.

Watched 'Nna Thaan Case Kodu'

Excellent satire.

Watching The Bold Type, it's quite inspiring. It is about how 3 women are friends and support each other to go up the corporate ladder. They face all hurdles together and help each other to overcome challenges put forward at their company.

On my second re-watch of Modern Family, hilarious show. Subtle comedy with a lot of good stuff sprinkled all over.

Also, on the watchlist is the second season of 'Only Murders in the Building'. Plus, the final season of 'What we do in the Shadows'.

All of the above are available on Disney+ (Hotstar).
It's not on any streaming platform right ?
